resources.string: Black is the most recessive of the acceptable German Shepherd colors. They are found in German and European working lines, American showlines and are not found in West German show lines.
This is the most common color in the breed. These dogs are born darker and lighten as they mature. The black color recedes and the tan will become prominent. They are found in various working lines.

The white color is actually an absence of color. It is called a masking gene, the true genetic color is masked making the dog appear white. It is also known as White Swiss Shepherd, Berger Blanc Swiss dog or the American-Canadian White Shepherd.
